Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveler67
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, I got a room with No View but a King sized bed that was very comfortable. Great Pillows!! The room was clean and well cared for. The free WIFI was great and worked at a good speed. The bathroom was good size but had limited counter space. Front desk staff were friendly, the building doorman was very helpful in finding things in the area. This a great area to stay, everything is in a 20 Minute or less walk from the hotel. The rooms are small, but that is common in Europe. The hotel is a good bargin and good place to Stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: twanny1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over a weekend. The room was spotless, big powerful shower, comfortable beds and the location is just perfect. You can walk everywhere. Our room (413) was on the Gran Via but you couldn't hear any noise because the double glazing is excellent. The only slight problem was the light from the screens across the street - even though there are thick black out curtains the light still comes through from around the edges. Will definitely stay here again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect for this price.”
Reviews.Author: whjh
Reviews.Content: Location, design, view, room size, bed comfort, bathroom (though a bit smelly), cleanliness, service, friendly and helpful staff, etc, etc. all above standard in particular for such a good room rate. Also my hotel again the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yesmore
Reviews.Content: Very nice designed hotel on perfect spot in the city. We had a great room with very large bathroom and nice view over the old city. They even have a roof terrace with a perfect view over the entire city! The beds were amazing, dont know the exact size, but i think 220cm by 220 cm... i almost lost my girlfriend one night :-) In short, don't doubt, just book, perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Joost R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend in nov 2011. The hotel just opened so everything was shiny and new! The hotel is located very near the city center with lots of shops nearby and a metro station right in front of the doorstep. The interior is nicely designed and practical. Good value for money. I would defenitely stay here again next time we visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Better then we imagined!”
Reviews.Author: nav k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my fiances birthday trip and it was amazing! the rooms were beautiful and clean, with brilliant views of montera and gran via..There were several prositutes outside but you never felt unsafe as there were lots of police around and a doorman always outside day or night. the staff were friendly and catered to all our needs, we had a problem with the hot water and someone came to check it within 15mins also had a little problem with the room safe and this was fixed promptly. The location of the hotel is brilliant, walking distance to everything, puerto del sol, gran via, plaza espana everything is within 15-20 minutes walking, The only little niggles were that an iron was not provided which meant we had to go buy a travel one and having stayed in several places before always had a provided iron and found it a bit odd that the sink was in the bedroom also the king size bed was huge but as it was two beds next to each other they always seperated during the night meaning one of us would have to get out of bed to push the bed back! none of these things majorly affected the stay though and if one thing was to be changed it would be the beds, alhtough they were very comfortable it was quite annoying having to push it back together or back, probably because of the wooden flooring! The room was cleaned well by the time we arrived back to our hotel every evening. Although you come to Madrid to see the sights etc and tend not to spend much time in the room, it was lovely to come back to such a lovely place. The corridors were quirky and everythign is well maintained and deocrated! I Would definetly come back again and my fiance is planning on having his stag weekend in Madrid and going back to praktik metropol. Fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT hotel in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: Samdhya
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for my honeymoon in Madrid for a total of 10 nights. This hotel had me impressed from the get go. The location is the best, right in Gran Vía. The staff was very friendly, from the doorman to the cleaning lady. We got there really early (about 7:30 AM) and they didn't hesitate on giving us a room right away, even if check in was supposed to be at 3PM. When we got to the room we were very happy to find it had a an imppressive view of Gran Vía. Since we traveled around Europe and came back to Madrid, we had a different room the second time around. This time it was even better, since it was bigger and had a balcony with a view to Gran Vía/ Calle Montera. The rooms are extremely nice, clean and modern. The shower is great and spacious. The hotel is far from finished, so I can't wait to see it when it is. I just hope the prices don't skyrocket! There was free internet service in the rooms, and free usage of computers in the lobby. The whole ambience of the hotel was inviting to relax and have a good time. I really can't say there was anything bad with this hotel. I just hope to return to Madrid soon enough to stay in Praktik and repeat that great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: AndySBBristol
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from Madrid and stayed at The Praktik and I could not fault it or the staff one bit! The room was a lot bigger than I thought it would be and it was very very clean, the staff were really friendly too. We did though have a problem one night where there was no hot water but with just one call to reception they got on it straight away and had hot water back on within 30 mins on a Sunday! If you are looking for a central location and value for money then I promise this hotel will be perfect for you. I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jellodoctor
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to most sites. Metro stop is just steps away. Very modern decor and very clean. Nice 1 Euro breakfast. The hallways and room were very hot and it was difficult to sleep in the hot rooms. My one recommendation would be to get the cold fan working.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Mona_y
Reviews.Content: Room were pretty, they provided us with a free baby cot. The building is really pretty, the location is central. Small elevator. No noise. Bed comfy. The only "problem" was that we had a room facing the pedestrian street and there are two billboards in front of the room on that street. The lights were getting in, curtains were to thin. It was really bright in the room at night. Ask for a room facing Grand Via.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms!! Rude female receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Aashika A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at possibly one of the best rooms of Praktik Metropol which had a lovely view of Gran Via with a balcony included. The rooms were white with lovely modern finishes and the furniture and side tables were extremely classy. The soundproofing was splendid and we slept very well despite facing a very commercial street. It is located very well- 2 steps from the metro station and few more from a host of shops and cafes. Also walkable is Sol. We did get a shock when we walked down C/Montera to reach Sol! The red light area completely caught us unaware!! The receptionist later told us that there was ample security and cops so we need not worry! There was a female receptionist who worked in the second half (and i didnt ask her name) who was extremely rude and snappy... and that didnt go down well with me. To conclude, we got great acco at a reasonable price bang on Gran Via.. and no real complaints in terms of comfort...

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but rather good”
Reviews.Author: JohnandTricia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights, it's right beside Gran Via metro station. First impression arriving late was a bit bleak as entrance is shared and with quite a few 'night workers' hanging around in the area, but once inside you find it is an old building revamped in a mixture of old/retro and modern. Takes a little getting used to but nice. The reception and lounge area is comfortable and communal, with coffee machine and free croisants and donuts in the morning. Also free internet access and some vending machines for snacks.Our room had a huge and very comfortable bed, very clean and nice bathroom with shower, overlooking Gran Via. Excellent location and reception staff very helpful. Really good value and you dont miss other facilities such as a bar because everybody is out and about in the city, and there are plenty bars and restaurants around you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff very helpful.....”
Reviews.Author: Adriano N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in front to the Gran Via Metro and 3 minutes walk from Puerta del Sol and thousands of shops .. Hotel very clean and staff very helpful, especially the guy who is always in the afternoon and night .. I recommend this hotel, and next time I come back to Madrid again will stay at this hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, and really practical”
Reviews.Author: Thomas G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Praktik in mid-september. Arrived much too early for the normal check-in time, but the helpful girl in reception managed to find me a room in spite of being really busy: great plus. The room was neat as a pin, with a big, comfortable bed, and very quiet. The common area was really nice, and I found the free Internet very helpful, as the closest cyber cafes are a good 15 minutes away. On the other side, the view to the inside light shaft was appalling (although I really did not care, being on a business trip), and the cleaning ladies entered my room while I was having a shower. It is true that the street is full of ladies of the evening (and the morning, an the afternoon...), but you never felt annoyed (as a matter of fact, they always seem to have a witty answer when you decline to hire their services). The location is just perfect, right in the middle of Madrid. On the whole, for business trips, a very good alternative to 4 star hotels in the area, such as El Coloso, Santo Domingo or Arosa.

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDebbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel one night in September. Madrid was having a heat wave, but the a/c in the room kept it nice and cool. Hotel is a very old building which has been completely refurbished. Rooms are small but bright and fresh. Comfortable beds. Very large bathroom. Free WIFI and safe. There is a large lounge on the 2nd floor, you can get 3 coffee and 1 pastry for 1 Euro - good deal for breakfast. Our room was basically soundproof to the outside, which is good considering it faced a busy square. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern, but smallest room ever!”
Reviews.Author: Darron W
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in late September. The room has only been opened a few weeks so the workmen were still there and it is clearly not finished. That is fine and cannot be helped. The location is great, v. central, but the rooms are what lets it down... I stayed in room 221 and we had approx 1ft (30cm) space between the bed and the walls! It was a bit like a dolls house! The bathroom has clear glass doors and no privacy. OK for brushing your teeth, but not if you are doing a number two!!! We had to resport to tying a bedsheet across the door lol Then we move onto the room location, I wish I had taken a picture to show how bad it was... our view was of the light shaft inside the building and covered in bird droppings. As such we spent the weekend with the curtains drawn and it was v. claustraphobic. We asked for a room move, but they were unfortunately full booked. The free wi-fi was great and the communal areas were nice. Plus the price was v. reasonable for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous new hotel, great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: GinaZ41
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in September of 2011, shortly after the hotel opened. Checked in around 6 pm and got a fantastic room on the 4th floor with a balcony out over Gran Via. Loved it. Very clean, modern decor, great bed, lovely sheets, towels, rain-head shower, not huge but room to move, very quiet. Very happy with it. Odd things were the door to the bathroom room was clear glass - so if your partner was sitting on the toilet, you could definitely see it from the bed - had to do some communicating and make sure the other person was not looking in...; and room did not have a blanket, just sheets. Was Sept, still very warm, but my huspand likes the air-con on high, so I was cold. Could have asked for a blanket, just kept forgetting. They have a common room on the 1st floor with a coffee machine and while we were there, provided free croissants and donuts, nice touch. Location was great, front door was about 8 steps to Gran Via subway entrance, and only about a 10 minute walk to Puerta del Sol. Felt very safe there at night, lots of people out and about, but noticed that some of those people were prostitutes, which seemed odd as it's not especially seedy. Overall thought it was great value and would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny”
Reviews.Author: ChristopheDublin
Reviews.Content: The room was really small and barely clean. Hookers around but I don't care. A little too expensive for the quality. The hotel has a very nice location in the center of Madrid close to the cultural location and night life area. Everything is new in the hotel and rooms are well decorated with very good equipments.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel and an incredible value”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: This is a great new hotel that is an outstanding value. It could not be in a more central location. It has superb, design magazine décor. Also a great common area – the ground level lobby/reception area is very small, but the floor above has a huge, wonderfully furnished living room with great light and views. The guest rooms have high ceilings and great fixtures/furnishings. I have never slept in more comfortable beds. The in-room safes are big enough for laptops. Climate controls are responsive. Wifi throughout the hotel is strong and free of charge. My only complaint has been mentioned by others; the bathrooms have clear glass doors. In our room, at least, the toilet was right in front of those doors. So when you sit on the can, you are in full view of anyone in the main room. This is just bizarre, and they need to do something about it. (And yes, as others have mentioned, the pedestrian street right in front of this hotel is sex worker central. It’s not a seedy area by any means; it just has a lot of pedestrian traffic, so this is where they ply their trade. They are forward – at least if you are a man between 15 and 80 – but not unpleasant. This didn’t bother me in the least, but it seems in the spirit of TripAdvisor to mention this to people who may feel differently.) I hope to stay in this hotel on future visits to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean but in the prostitute street!”
Reviews.Author: rochelle030
Reviews.Content: This is a very cheap hotel and does the job for a few nights stay to see the sights of Madrid. However you get what you pay for. The rooms are clearly new (still smelt of paint/polish) but are tiny. We had around a 2m x 3m area between the bed and the bathroom. Also the bathroom doors are see through! In areas the hotel seemed unfinished as we noticed printed out pieces of paper blu-tacked on the walls to direct you to the room numbers. The upper two floors are hostel rooms. We also got woken up early every day by the cleaners shouting down the corridor. Don't expect a lie in! There is a lovely communal area which has boxes of pastries to help yourself to in the morning and coffee and vending machines and free use of two internet stations which is handy for travelers. However the main thing to note is that the hotel is located on the main prostitute street of Madrid. The corner of the hotel backs onto the Gran Via so it's always a very lively area but there are constant prostitutes hanging around right outside and down the street. For the price we paid however, it was fine but would look for an alternative next time.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but they get their basics right”
Reviews.Author: PleunBhoy
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel on great location in the heart of the city. The very claen rooms have a great bed, some storage room and a great shower.That's about all there is in a room but do you need anything else? We particularly liked the location. Close to the touristy Plaza Mayor and Puerto del Sol but also not to far from bohemian Malasana. Allthough the hotel is on a very busy street, there's is no noise to be heard from outside. The only drawback is the lack of good sunblinds....

Reviews.Title: “Clean and fresh new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelBookWorm
Reviews.Content: Bright and airy rooms. Rain shower head. Great location. Subway entrance right outside the main door, and there is a nice shopping district to the north. At first I was concerned that the hotel would be noisy since it is right on the busy Gran Via, but the double glazed windows arrested the street sounds nicely. You can tell that they are still working out the bugs of running a hotel, but the benefit is that everything is clean and fresh, from the bathroom grout to the paint on the walls. One minor inconvenience is that there is no fridge in the hotel... for medications or for food and wine. We stayed on the fourth floor and enjoyed a balcony view of Gran Via. Side note: my new happy place is the Parque del Retiro. Do as the locals do, and spread a blanket out by the monument overlooking the rowboats on the lake. Fantastic place to journal, read, or just enjoy the setting sun. Can't wait to go back. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Johnsaxspain
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for my wife and I. It is in the Centre of Madrid and we walked everywhere, it is clean and modern and the beds are really comfortable. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel as there is so many cafe,s so close and we enjoyed trying different places daily. There are no swimming pools, suana, gym etc if thats what you are looking for this is not the place, but for a stay in Madrid for sightseeing or business i would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a find - Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smileme2you
Reviews.Content: This is a newly openned gem of a hotel - a true joy of a find! My husband and I stayed here for the first four nights of its new existance and loved it! Its position, less than one minutes walk from the Grand Via metro is the first of many things to recommend this hotel. Our Room (401) was large and beautifully decorated in white wood panelling - ideal for those hot summer days! The bed was massive and very comfortable, the airconditionin-marvellous and the shower, out of this world! Our room also had a balcony overlooking Gran Via and the pedestrian area beside it. Ideal for people watching on those warm evenings! The room had two huge french windows which when closed provided excellent sound proofing if you need quiet for a good night's sleep. It is 5 mins walk to Puerto de Sol and easy distances from everywhere else in Madrid. The tourist bus stops just across the road. There are lots of eating places right outside the hotel's front door. The very best feature of this hotel however is its EXCELLENT staff - friendly, energetic, enthusiastic and helpful! A wonderful find and rightly deserves to be much higher up the list in Madrid. I have every confidence with a number of months running under its belt it will rise meterorically - it really is that good!
